medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient noticed her gait became increasingly unbalanced two weeks before admission, describing walking 'like a drunk person.' Bifrontal and occipital headache with neck pain developed over several days. Symptoms worsened, and nausea developed when bending forward. There was marked deterioration in balance, leading to a fall in the shower, and others noticed she tended to neglect her left side.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bilateral breast-reduction surgery 10 years prior; allergic to morphine and oxycodone; no chronic illnesses specified.
medical_history.social_history: Emigrated from Brazil to the U.S. nine years prior; self-employed housekeeper; lives with boyfriend; consumes alcohol approximately once every six months; does not smoke or use illicit drugs.
